title: CLAUDE.md
text: package organized four main R files: get_token() - Authentication get_profiles() - User profile data get_follows() - Following relationships get_user_posts() - User post data follow_actor() - Follow users programmatically init_net() - Create initial network key actor expand_net() - Iteratively expand network using keyword filtering build_network() - Complete network building pipeline add_metrics() - Add network analysis metrics trim_net() - Filter networks criteria resp2df() - Convert API responses data frames post2df() - Parse post data API responses check_wait() - Handle API rate limiting Token refresh validation helpers R/blueskynet-package.R - Package documentation imports

title: CLAUDE.md
text: API Token Management: package handles Bluesky authentication access tokens refresh tokens. API functions expect valid token parameter can refresh tokens automatically long-running operations. Network Data Structure: Networks represented tibbles two key columns: - actor_handle - user following - follows_handle - user followed Iterative Network Expansion: expand_net() function uses threshold-based approach grow networks iteratively, filtering new candidates keyword matching user profiles minimum follower counts. Rate Limiting: package includes built-handling Bluesky API rate limits automatic waiting token refresh capabilities.

title: Analyze Networks on the Bluesky Social Network
text: First, create app password : https://bsky.app/settings/app-passwords. , set environment variable BLUESKY_APP_PASS app password, another variable, BLUESKY_APP_USER, identifier (e.g. “lassehjorthmadsen.bsky.social”) using file.edit("~/.Renviron") Now, can access core function blueskynet: First rows starting point initial network: ’re ready, can build bigger net, several supporting artifacts, like 3d-widget, using build_network() won’t run , since can take lot time build big network.
code: library(blueskynet) library(dplyr)  # Authenticate yourself password <- Sys.getenv("BLUESKY_APP_PASS") identifier <- Sys.getenv("BLUESKY_APP_USER")  # Then get a token and a refresh token auth_object <- get_token(identifier, password) token <- auth_object$accessJwt refresh_tok <- auth_object$refreshJwt  # Establish a small net as a starting point key_actor <- "natalieamiri.bsky.social" keywords <- c("reporter", "journalist", "writer") small_net <- init_net(key_actor, keywords, token) small_net |> head(3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   actor_handle             follows_handle           #>   <chr>                    <chr>                    #> 1 natalieamiri.bsky.social saschalobo.bsky.social   #> 2 natalieamiri.bsky.social heute.nachrichten.com.de #> 3 natalieamiri.bsky.social iranjournal.bsky.social

code: # Sample user descriptions descriptions <- c(   "Data scientist working on machine learning projects",   "Climate researcher studying global warming effects",   "Marine biologist researching ocean ecosystems",   "Environmental data scientist analyzing climate patterns" )  # Get top words word_freq <- word_freqs(descriptions, top = 10) head(word_freq) #>     feature frequency rank docfreq group #> 1      data         2    1       2   all #> 2 scientist         2    1       2   all #> 3   climate         2    1       2   all #> 4   working         1    4       1   all #> 5   machine         1    4       1   all #> 6  learning         1    4       1   all  # Get top bigrams bigram_freq <- word_freqs(descriptions, bigrams = TRUE, top = 5) head(bigram_freq) #>             feature frequency rank docfreq group #> 1    data scientist         2    1       2   all #> 2 scientist working         1    2       1   all #> 3   working machine         1    2       1   all #> 4  machine learning         1    2       1   all #> 5 learning projects         1    2       1   all  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # With real profile data from network analysis auth <- get_token("your.handle.bsky.social", "your-app-password") profiles <- get_profiles(c("user1.bsky.social", "user2.bsky.social"), auth$accessJwt) word_analysis <- word_freqs(profiles$description, top = 50) } # }
